tweets.text:
A major clean up operation has begun in #Northwich 

Working in partnership with @Go_CheshireWest and @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/sszfHCXPJ6

#Flood water in #Worcester is expected to peak tonight at 5.7m - that's just slightly lower than last February. Stay safe, stay #floodaware and do not walk or drive through flood water under any circumstances https://t.co/jyPTiJnSjg

OMG a 🐖 farm on a slope that drains to the river Cong a tiny Chalkstream with White Clawed Crayfish The ditch has now been filled with mud allowing all the contaminated water & 🐖💩to still pollute it @EnvAgencyAnglia @The_WMA @N_Rivers_Trust @Feargal_Sharkey grid ref TF 713 242 https://t.co/ioDlbFGMs9 https://t.co/cbUcWTSOGP
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency How Sewage Overflow Assessment Framework document  was overlooked by the Task Force is a travesty.

Wow.... water storage at #Bickershaw during Storm Christoph 3ha of floods a metre deep on the flood plain @EnvAgency @WiganCouncil @Lancswildlife This is slow the flow at the landscape scale....... https://t.co/1rvzNsFt07

Images from our Geomatics team taken yesterday showing the volume of water in the #Trent floodplain making its way through #Nottingham. The Left Bank Scheme at Victoria Embankment is operating as designed, helping to protect thousands of properties from #flood water https://t.co/gt1lvcIVBe

Today Prime Minister @BorisJohnson visited Didsbury to see how the @EnvAgency and the emergency services are working with local and national government to defend against flooding and support those who might be affected. https://t.co/8U8rHrhdZv

tweets.text:
FLOOD ALERT UPDATE 10AM 23/1/21. SEE BELOW 👇 IN THE SCREENSHOT FOR A LIST OF ROAD CLOSURES 🚧⚠️, PASSABLE WITH CAUTION ⚠️ ROAD'S, CLEAR ✅ ROAD'S & THE GOOD NEWS THAT THE RIVER SOAR AT PILLINGS LOCK RIVER GAUGE IS FINALLY DROPPING 📉 BUT TO STILL ISE CAUTION ⚠️.
@tinaonions https://t.co/GnDsCpF4Z4

The #Nailbourne has a good flow across the road in #Elmstead near #Barham The @EnvAgencySE  #FieldTeam are removing blockages, if you see anything please call 0800807060 ⁦

Credit @DeTom48 https://t.co/6WErsGtzIT

Really sad to see this. Our thoughts of course are with all those affected. 

We've been working with #partners on site overnight & will continue to do so.  

The River #Severn is still rising but as Dave says all other defences are OK & all downstream (& upstream) are in place. https://t.co/wlGbfX8ChZ

Flooding at Lunt Meadows where the River Alt embankment collapsed on Wednesday. The embankment collapse protected hundreds of people in Maghull. This will happen again and government must reconsider it’s rejection of funding bids by @EnvAgency https://t.co/haEWuEzjwB

tweets.text: More views on the impact of HS2 tunnelling on the chalk aquifer that feeds our river like the @RiverChess, River Colne and River Misbourne and also supplies our domestic water supply via @AffinityWater. Competency of HS2 and the @EnvAgency needs to be questioned. https://t.co/rJpArAg8YR
Wet side, dry side, full height #Bewdley #Worcestershire @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/AZLCBdh8kD

Some more views on the impact of HS2 tunnelling on the chalk aquifer. The @EnvAgency have been good at setting poor targets and their skills at sweeping problems under the carpet are beyond compare. https://t.co/TwtS8yViJP

@EnvAgencyMids The confluence of the Trent and Soar, I've taken the liberty of running a filter or two on your smashing capture. @networkrail infrastructure down there and a flurry of @CanalRiverTrust. Perhaps two power stations for @EngineerLondon as well. @GarethDennis might like this. https://t.co/Ss1wCmyuzw

"Hey, mam, I'm on the telly!" Ada, Trevor and Col, our independent ecosystem engineers are @BBCWinterwatch stars! These wild, hardy hooved helpers munch their way through tough vegetation in wet and flooded areas to help naturally manage our sites. #winterwatch
📷 P Gould https://t.co/So0fdPPjcq

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Winterwatch
entity.description: `Winterwatch' continues the BBC's rich tradition of nature documentaries that show off the beauty of the planet and various wildlife species. From their base at the Cairngorms National Park in Scotland, which is twice the size of the Lake District, presenters Chris Packham, Michaela Strachan and Gillian Burke discover ways that the area's animals survive the challenges that come with winter. With short days, plummeting temperatures and a lack of food, cameras monitor the animals' movements. Beavers, pine martens, golden eagles and red squirrels are among the species featured in the programme.

domain.name: TV Episodes
domain.description: Television show episodes

entity.name: Winterwatch
entity.description: `Winterwatch' continues the BBC's rich tradition of nature documentaries that show off the beauty of the planet and various wildlife species. From their base at the Cairngorms National Park in Scotland, which is twice the size of the Lake District, presenters Chris Packham, Michaela Strachan and Gillian Burke discover ways that the area's animals survive the challenges that come with winter. With short days, plummeting temperatures and a lack of food, cameras monitor the animals' movements. Beavers, pine martens, golden eagles and red squirrels are among the species featured in the programme.

tweets.text:
Many rivers in England are still at high levels. If you’re leaving the house this weekend, don’t take any unnecessary risks and stay away from swollen rivers. 

Check your flood risk at: https://t.co/xNlgwQ9Q4z 

#StormChristoph #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/cOiHqWwiyB

@AliceSofield @EnvAgencyNW Johnson’s security entourage of dozens of police, Personal plain clothes operatives, 15 or so vehicles etc, must have cost tens of thousands of pounds yet we as residents on the nearest street to the river have not been provided with ONE sandbag. Shamefull

When the @EnvAgency announced it was considering giving a permit for a giant waste incinerator at Rivenhall in her Witham constituency, Priti Patel said the EA “wasn’t fit for purpose”. Here’s Boris Johnson wearing an EA jacket https://t.co/1qgvqFoCKs

@SarahPhillips8 The @envagency need to look at other environmentally friendly alternatives before jumping in to bed with an aggregates company and agreeing to rip out a hillside on the edge of the historic medieval  market town of Coggeshall 
https://t.co/PbavsQuoYC
@mickhick_mike @SussexIncidents @EnvAgencySE Hi no this is definitely near Canterbury in Kent on the Nailbourne

Hugh multiagency efforts overnight on Wallgates Lane to sandbag a fault in flood defences in Wallgates Lane @NortonOnDerwent More work today on identifying the problem. Thankyou @EnvAgencyYNE @NYFRS @RyedaleDC @northyorkscc @scarrescue
@clemserrell @WorcsTravel @worcscc @myworcester @EnvAgencyMids @worcester_uni @universityarena @firstworcester @clemserrell did you make it?

@PJennings88 The Sewage Overflow Assessment Framework is just another failed attempt by the @EnvAgency to exonerate themselves for any responsibility for the appalling state of our rivers. 

It's a shameful document.

The Storm Overflow Assessment Framework is an agreement between the water industry and the @EnvAgnecy that allows the water companies to pollute our rivers with almost total immunity.

Q: Does anyone know a "Simon J Withey" who drafted it?

Twitter do your thing. https://t.co/4obpXIfpxV

tweets.text:
Extremely important advice from @EnvAgency Chair @EmmaHowardBoyd - please take note, and please take care.

#PrepareActSurvive #TeamEA https://t.co/8hXGOE4O4m

The @EnvAgencyMids say they've issued a new flood warning for Bewdley after they were made aware that the temporary defences at Beales' Corner have been compromised. They're not aware of any injuries. @GOVUK have also issued warnings #HeartNews https://t.co/yB6Awrst5Y

@AJHigginson @SouthportReport @Bill_Esterson @seftoncouncil @stlukesce @CllrDDutton @FormbyParish @BorisJohnson @EnvAgency There will always be risk. With new developments the risk must not be increased. Sustainable drainage must be and is built in. Planning guidance is written so developers know exactly what they need to do to get permission and will get it from govt anyway even if council says no..

tweets.text:
We’ve issued a new #flood warning for #Bewdley after being made aware the temporary defences at Beales’ Corner have been compromised. 

We’re not aware of any injuries.

We have people on site and are investigating the impacts.

Check your flood risk at: https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/RPh2krppaJ

Worcester city 23/1 @ 7am:

⛔️ Hylton Road
⛔️ Tybridge Street
⛔️ North Parade
⛔️ Dolday
⛔️ Croft Road
⛔️ The Butts
⛔️ Castle Street
✅ New Road & main bridge - contraflow
✅ St John's open up to Henwick Road
🚌 Reduced @firstworcester bus services https://t.co/nAahvsw2ad

tweets.text: @EnvAgencyYNE has advised the River Derwent in Malton has now peaked at 5.05m, but due to its low-responding nature, water levels are likely to remain high for some days. Levels not expected to rise any further. The flood water situation remains fragile and challenging (3/5)

A flood warning for Norton was issued on Friday evening. The Environment Agency teams worked with @NorthYorksFire to set up pumps at the end of Wallgates Lane, as well as manoeuvring sandbags by boat to alleviate flood water from the river in this location (2/5)
@ScottGardnerCM @EnvAgencyNW Pleased you got the right response Scott #greenkeeping you need a quick result when issues crop up like this #burstriverbank #flooding

Some views on the impact of HS2 tunnelling on the chalk aquifer that feeds our river like the @RiverChess, River Colne and River Misbourne and also supplies our domestic water supply via @AffinityWater https://t.co/YygcO4Ezbo
